definition: your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)
(long) time/(long) duration of time
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Your name has tong resounded in my ears.

definition: I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)

knowing sb by their reputation can't compare to meeting them in person (idiom)

definition: nice to meet you
lit. like thunder piercing the ear/a well-known reputation (idiom)
lit. I've admired you for a long time (honorific)./I've been looking forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
we are honored by your presence
It is a great honor to meet you.
the blessing of three lifetimes (idiom)/(courteous language) it's my good fortune...
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
famous/celebrated
truth to tell/to be quite honest...
seeing once is better than hearing a hundred times (idiom); seeing for oneself is better than hearing from many others/seeing is believing
